metadata.title: CVE-2023-52682 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: f2fs:fix to wait on block writeback for post_read case If inode is compressed,but not encrypted, it missed to call f2fs_wait_on_block_writeback() to waitfor GCed page writeback in IPU write path. Thread A GC-Thread - f2fs_gc -do_garbage_collect - gc_data_segment - move_data_block -f2fs_submit_page_write migrate normal cluster's block via meta_inode's pagecache - f2fs_write_single_data_page - f2fs_do_write_data_page -f2fs_inplace_write_data - f2fs_submit_page_bio IRQ - f2fs_read_end_io IRQold data overrides new data due to out-of-order GC and common IO. -f2fs_read_end_io

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52682` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-generic-64k - 6.5.0-41.41
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1021-aws - 6.5.0-1021.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-azure - 6.5.0-1022.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-gcp - 6.5.0-1022.24
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1017-laptop - 6.5.0-1017.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-lowlatency - 6.5.0-41.41.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-41.41.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1024-oracle - 6.5.0-1024.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1024-oracle-64k - 6.5.0-1024.24
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1018-raspi - 6.5.0-1018.21
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1015-starfive - 6.5.0-1015.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-41.41').
linux-aws package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1021.21').
linux-azure package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1022.23').
linux-gcp package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1022.24').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1017.20').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-41.41.1').
linux-oracle package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1024.24').
linux-raspi package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1018.21').
linux-starfive package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1015.16').
